txt.en: You defended the Mustering Tree long enough to hinder the Dunlending advance
You have defended the Mustering Tree
You have travelled with Léofward to the Mustering Tree, where Thurbald, Elfrith, and Cuthric have joined you to defend against the combined forces of the Dragon and Ox-clans.

'Plan, [placeholder]? We are few against two companies of Dunlending warriors. I plan only to take as many of them as I can with me to the grave and hope that my sacrifice is not in vain.

'I cannot fault you for preserving your own life, so if the battle goes ill, you may take Longstride and escape the battle.

'To arms, brothers! For Eorl! For Helm! To arms!'
Léofward is at the Mustering Tree.\n\nYou should speak with Léofward to learn his plan before the battle begins.
'I am too wounded to continue the fight..let us leave!'
Defend the Mustering Tree from the Dunlending forces.
Defend the Mustering Tree against the Dunlending forces.
